Mathematical Model

The 2D shallow water system for the free-surface flow with the Coriolis effect and bottom friction stress is formulated as,

{∂tH+∇⋅(Hu)=0,∂t(Hu)+∇⋅(Hu⊗u)+12∇(gH2)=−gH∇h−fc×(Hu)+S,(1)\begin{cases} \partial_t H + \nabla \cdot (H \mathbf{u}) = 0, \\ \partial_t (H \mathbf{u}) + \nabla \cdot (H \mathbf{u} \otimes \mathbf{u}) + \frac{1}{2} \nabla (g H^2) = -g H \nabla h - f_c \times (H \mathbf{u}) + \mathbf{S}, \end{cases} \tag{1}

where the unknowns are the total water column thickness H=h(x,y)+η(x,y,t)H = h(x,y) + \eta(x,y,t), with hh the still-water bathymetric depth, η\eta the free surface elevation; and the horizontal speed mean u(t,x,y)\mathbf{u}(t,x,y). The parameter fcf_c is linked to the angular speed of the earth's rotation, and S\mathbf{S} is the source term, i.e. viscosity terms for the closure problem. The momentum equation of then (1)(1) becomes

∂t(Hu)+∇⋅(Hu⊗u)+12∇(gH2)=−gH∇h−fc×Hu+S+νΔ(Hu),(2)\partial_t (H \mathbf{u}) + \nabla \cdot (H \mathbf{u} \otimes \mathbf{u}) + \frac{1}{2} \nabla (g H^2) = -g H \nabla h - f_c \times H \mathbf{u} + \mathbf{S} + \nu \Delta (H\mathbf{u}), \tag{2}

For simplicity, we rewrite system (2)(2) in a conservative flux form,

∂U∂t+∂F(U)∂x+∂G(U)∂y=S(U),\frac{\partial \mathbf{U}}{\partial t} +\frac{\partial \mathbf{F}(\mathbf{U})}{\partial x} +\frac{\partial \mathbf{G}(\mathbf{U})}{\partial y} = \mathbf{S}(\mathbf{U}),

with fluxes

F(U)=(HuHu2+12gH2Huv),G(U)=(HvHuvHv2+12gH2).\mathbf{F}(\mathbf{U})= \begin{pmatrix} Hu \\ Hu^{2}+\frac12 gH^{2} \\ Huv \end{pmatrix}, \qquad \mathbf{G}(\mathbf{U})= \begin{pmatrix} Hv \\ Huv \\ Hv^{2}+\frac12 gH^{2} \end{pmatrix}.

Let fc(x,y)f_c(x,y) be the Coriolis parameter, ρw\rho_w water density, pa(x,y,t)p_a(x,y,t) atmospheric pressure, τw=(τwx,τwy)\boldsymbol{\tau}_w=(\tau_{wx},\tau_{wy}) wind stress at the surface, and τb\boldsymbol{\tau}_b bottom stress. Then

S(U)=(−gH∂xh−gH∂yh)+(fHv−fHu)+(−Hρw∂xpa−Hρw∂ypa)+(1ρwτwx1ρwτwy)(1ρwτbx1ρwτby).\mathbf{S}(\mathbf{U})= \begin{pmatrix} -gH \partial_x h \\ -gH \partial_y h \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} fHv \\ -fHu \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} -\dfrac{H}{\rho_w}\partial_x p_a \\ -\dfrac{H}{\rho_w}\partial_y p_a \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} \dfrac{1}{\rho_w}\tau_{wx} \\ \dfrac{1}{\rho_w}\tau_{wy} \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} \dfrac{1}{\rho_w}\tau_{bx} \\ \dfrac{1}{\rho_w}\tau_{by} \end{pmatrix}.

Common closures

Bottom stress

Quadratic drag

−1ρwτb=−Cd∣u∣u.\begin{align*} -\frac{1}{\rho_w}\boldsymbol{\tau}_b &= -C_d|\mathbf{u}|\mathbf{u}. \end{align*}

Manning's

−1ρwτb=−gn2H−1/3∣u∣u.\begin{align*} -\frac{1}{\rho_w}\boldsymbol{\tau}_b &= -gn^2H^{-1/3}|\mathbf{u}|\mathbf{u}. \end{align*}

Wind stress

Quadratic drag

1ρwxτw=ρaρwCD∣u10∣u10\frac{1}{\rho_{wx}} \boldsymbol{\tau}_w = \frac{\rho_a}{\rho_w} C_D |\mathbf{u_{10}}|\mathbf{u_{10}}

Large & Pond (1981)

CD={(1.2+0.04U10)×10−3,U10<11  ms−1(0.49+0.065U10)×10−3,11≤U10≤25C_D = \begin{cases} (1.2 + 0.04 U_{10}) \times 10^{-3} &,U_{10} < 11 \; \mathrm{ms^{-1}} \\ (0.49 + 0.065 U_{10}) \times 10^{-3} &,11 \leq U_{10} \leq 25 \end{cases}

Powell / Donelan (2004)

CD={CD0+αU10,U10≤UcCD,max≈(2.0−2.5)×10−3,U10>UcC_D = \begin{cases} C_{D0} + \alpha U_{10} &,U_{10} \leq U_c \\ C_{D,max} \approx (2.0-2.5) \times 10^{-3} &,U_{10} > U_c \end{cases}
